thread.title: Ute and boat sink into Cromwell lake after rolling down hill
thread.title_full: Ute and boat sink into Cromwell lake after rolling down hill

author: Jo McKenzie-McLean
title: Ute and boat sink into Cromwell lake after rolling down hill
text:
Ute and boat sink into Cromwell lake after rolling down hill JO MCKENZIE-MCLEAN Last updated 15:30, February 4 2017 Jo McKenzie-McLeanâ€‹/STUFF.CO.NZ 
A tow truck and tractor pulled a ute, boat and trailer from Lake Dunstan in Cromwell on Saturday afternoon. 
A Christchurch man tried desperately to unhook his boat before it sank to the bottom of a Central Otago lake with his Ford Ranger ute. 
Jock Saxton, 25, of Christchurch, said he was in Cromwell with his girlfriend and friend to go jet boating but the trip soured before they even got on the water. 
"The truck was parked up and we went for a walk around the beach and the handbrake must not have been fully engaged and some guy just about stopped it but didn't quite and sure enough it came down, floated out and sunk." 
A ute, boat and trailer had to be pulled out of Cromwell's Lake Dunstan on Saturday afternoon after the handbrake was not was not on properly. 
Alerted to the commotion, Saxton swam out to his sinking ute, he said. 
"I swam out to try and detach the boat but just about got it but then it full sunk. There's not much I could do really. I was standing on it at the last moment before it went fully under." 
Allan Campbell, who helped recover the vehicles, said it was "a bit awkward" because the ute was upside down on the bottom of the lake. 
04022017. Photo: Jo Mckenzie-Mclean/Fairfax NZ A ute, boat and trailer had to be pulled out of Cromwell's Lake Dunstan on Saturday afternoon after the handbrake was not was not on properly. 
"It was all tangled up. It went out probably 50 metres which I have never had one out that far before. We have done jobs like this before but regrettably with bodies, but this was good, there was not body recovery." 
Diver Steve Bell said the ute and boat was down about 11 metres. 
"The truck was actually upside down and the trailer and boat were on top of the truck. So we had to get the boat off, then trailer off, the had to roll the truck the right way up...It's bad luck for the young fella."
